section.name: What is it?
section.p: The jSPF library is pure Java SPF implementation. It was designed to match the current SPF-Specs of 2006-2007 (See RFC section). SPF is also knows as Sender Policy Framework. It was designed to detect email spoofing.This is the solution if you ever was tired of getting spam from yourself. For more informations see openspf website.

subsection.p: We proud to announce the release of jSPF-0.9b5. This release supports asynchron processing and is fully RFC4408 conform

After some more work was done, we proud to announce the release of jSPF-0.9b4. 0.9b4 correctly supports SPF DNS record type (previously we only supported TXT record type) and introduce support for spf extension policies like fallback, override, trusted forwarder.
0.9b3 introduces YAML based unit tests to check RFC compliance and a couple of minor fixes.
subsection.h4: Jul/2006 - First public release of jSPF
subsection.p: After a fully rewrite of spf-java we finally release jSPF.

section.name: releases
section.p:
Latest: jSPF v0.9b5
jSPF v0.9b5 is the current release. Both binary and source distributions are available.
This release passes all YAML tests published by openspf.org (still under development). So it should be fully RFC4408 compliant.
